meanings.definition: A thick yellowish or greenish opaque liquid produced in infected tissue, consisting of dead white blood cells and bacteria with tissue debris and serum.
meanings.sent1: The doctor drained the pus from the wound to help it heal.
meanings.sent2: The pus oozed out of the pimple when it was squeezed.
meanings.sent3: The pus looked like melted cheese, making everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The pus was a revolting mix of bacteria and dead cells, like a tiny swamp in the wound.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the pus was so strong, it made my stomach turn.

meanings.sent1: The wound began to pus, indicating an infection.
meanings.sent2: After a few days, the cut started to pus and needed medical attention.
meanings.sent3: The infected area decided to pus at the worst possible time, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: The wound seemed to pus endlessly, like a leaky faucet.
meanings.sent5: The pusing wound was a clear sign that it needed immediate care.
